page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area surveyed lies to the N.E. of the town of Basingstoke. There is varied land use including farming, light industry, woodland and extensive residential areas. Both private and local authority housing are integrated to provide residential areas for commuters to Reading, London and local light industrial and administrative work. There has been a considerable programme of private and local authority building to cater for the London overspill. Land is still being developed for extra housing and the improvement and new building of a network of roads. There is some protected parkland and woodland to be found, as well as several outlying working farms. The area has undergone rapid development in the past 20 years, the emphasis changing from agricultural to administrative centres
